text:
If the user presses the stop button in his browser, mod_jk2 will throw an error 
because the stream that it is trying to write to is closed. This error should 
NOT be returned as a 500 error code to Apache (or any other web-server for that 
matter) because it hides real 500 internal server errors (i.e. Tomcat not 
running or something equally drastic).
creator: pyropunk@usa.net
hgomez@apache.org
text: Do you suggest to return instead 200 ?

creator: hgomez@apache.org
text: Thanks to take a look at CVS code, return 206 instead

creator: pyropunk@usa.net
text:
Various options:
200 - request completed sucessfull. That the user has gone away should be of no 
consequence to the server.
204 - no content. If no content was served to the user.
206 - partial content. If partial content was served to the user.
503 - service temporarily unavailable. sonce the failure is temporary this 
could be indicated.

My preference is for 204/206.
